prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 03
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

Ready for the third workout in the Dynamic Focus series? All athletes, including competitors in endurance sports, benefit from training that better helps you react to external factors in varying directions; people, wind, waves, inclines, and surfaces. This sequence will prime you for these variables with varying tempos. With a combination of exercises that integrate three-dimensional motion this session will keep your neuromuscular system primed and ready for anything, no matter what type of rubber you’re on.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Runners Stretch-Alternating
- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps

- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Single-Leg Hip Rotations

prospects.name: Full Body 10
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This routine marks a big step up in duration -- including nearly 8 minutes of core work. That's right, you can have the strongest legs in the world, but without a solid core, you won’t be able to put down the power efficiently. As we continue to increase your leg strength, we need to make sure your core endurance improves as well.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

- Standing Hip Drive with Hands Up

- Reverse Lunge with Hands Over Head
- Backward Lunge
- Lateral Lunge with Extended Hands
- Single-Leg Squat with Hands Forward

- Goblet Squat
- Bulgarian Squat

prospects.name: Breathing to Crush Them
prospects.description: This is the breathing technique used by Navy Seals to help them focus and find calm before major operations. Learn and use this technique before heading into your own major events and races.

prospects.name: Breathing More Deeply
prospects.description: Diaphragmatic Breathing is a calming exercise that encourages you to breathe deeply into your abdomen. This can help improve your ability to take in oxygen on the bike, as well as help you stay calm on focused when the pressure is on.

prospects.name: Posterior Chain Focus 01
prospects.description:
_The primary objective of the Posterior Chain Series is to activate and strengthen the muscles on the back side of your body. This includes everything from your powerful glutes, hamstrings, and calves to the postural muscles of your upper back and neck._

​

Your posterior chain is responsible for back and hip extension as well as knee flexion. It is vital in maintaining optimal posture during cycling and running in addition to water position in swimming. In this first session, we introduce some basic movements that focus on the activation and stabilization of posterior chain muscles. These moves include a combination of eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding) contractions. They provide your body with the foundation for more demanding moves to come. This is also a good session to come back to if you feel like you could use a quick posterior chain activation or tune-up.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Side bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Split Stance Hip Hinges
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Kneeling Hip Extension
- Quadruped w/ Cervical Extension
- Quadruped Chin Tucks
- Double Leg Hip Bridge
- High Plank w/ Alt. Arm Raise
- High Plank w/ Hip Abduction + Tap
- 45° Reverse Fly w/ Reps
- Lat Press on Wall-Reps
- 90° Reverse Fly w/ Reps
- Overhead Reverse Fly w/ Hold
- KickBacks from Toes
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Marching Hip Bridge
- Back Extension w/ opposite arm & leg raise
- Downward Dog
- Pigeon Stretch

prospects.name: Upper Body Focus 01
prospects.description:
_The primary goal of this series is to increase strength in the major muscles of the chest, back, shoulders and arms. We’ll also focus on improving mobility, stability, and flexibility in the upper body. So get ready for great body-weight-based routines that focus on quality repetitions, endurance holds, and range of motion challenges._

​

As the first session in this series, we’re going to introduce you to some basic upper body movements. This sequence will be beneficial for endurance sports where you need some upper body strength and improved posture, such as swimming, cycling (especially MTB and Cyclocross), and running. To help ensure overall strength, this routine incorporates some core muscle exercises and you may find some portions of the sequence difficult. No problem! Take your time to understand the movement. Pause the video if you need to and embrace the process of mastering new exercises.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Overhead Shoulder Rolls
- Standing T-Spine Rotations
- Lat Press with a Hold
- Hip Hinges on the Wall
- 45 Degree Reverse Fly
- Wide Pushups
- Quadruped Pull-In with Hold
- Quadruped Push-Out with Hold
- Low Plank with Scapular Presses
- Low Side Plank with Toe Taps
- High Plank with Alternate Arm Raise
- Back Extensions
- Cervical Extensions
- Chin Tucks from a Quadruped Position
- Quadruped T-Spine Rotations
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Side-Lying T-Spine Arcs

prospects.name: Run Focus 3
prospects.description:
The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

Run Focus 3 adds an additional layer of difficulty to the foundational moves, with dynamic movements and sequences that help build balance and stability. There are also more integrated variations that incorporate the upper body for full-body activation. This session maintains the strong focus on glute and thigh musculature, as well as enhancing stability at the ankle and hip, and ensuring the engagement of the three-dimensional core.

​

**Included Exercises:**

- Squat Wide Stance Hands Forward
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Standing Hip Drive Hands Up
- Split Stance Side bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Foot Circles
- Donkey Kick
- Backward Lunge Arms on Hips
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Backward Lunge Shoulder Press
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Single Leg Heel Raise
- Hip Hinge-Hands on Head
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Tempo Hip Hinge
- Inchworm
- Single leg Lateral Hop to Hold
- Downward Dog
- Frog Crunch
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Bicycle Crunch
- Bird Dog
- Pigeon Stretch
- Runner Stretch

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 03
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

Ready for the third workout in the Dynamic Focus series? All athletes, including competitors in endurance sports, benefit from training that better helps you react to external factors in varying directions; people, wind, waves, inclines, and surfaces. This sequence will prime you for these variables with varying tempos. With a combination of exercises that integrate three-dimensional motion this session will keep your neuromuscular system primed and ready for anything, no matter what type of rubber you’re on.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Runners Stretch-Alternating
- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Single-Leg Hip Rotations
- Squat and Hold to Jump
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Low Skip In Place
- Tempo Squat
- Fast Side Lunge w/ Knee Lift
- Pogo Jumps
- Forward Shoulder Rolls
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Chin Tucks Reps
- Single-Leg Hop to Hold -Square Pattern
- Split Squats
- High Side Plank w/ rotation
- Pigeon Stretch

prospects.name: Full Body 01
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This is the first routine in the Full Body series. It introduces the most basic versions of moves that make up the majority of this program. Some of these moves may seem very basic but we encourage you to focus on perfect form and execution during these early levels so that when we turn up the heat you have things nailed. As you'll see, all the exercises at the lower levels will progress in a similar fashion going forward. We're building strength, but also fine-tuning your nervous system. As the program progresses you'll be asked to complete more difficult variations on each foundational move.

​

As with all the strength training routines, it helps if you’ve done a warm-up before getting started. That can be one of your favorite yoga routines, riding your bike on the trainer for 5-10 minutes, or doing a personal stretching routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Goblet Squat
- Single-Leg Squat
- Backward Lunge
- Hip Hinge with Reach
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Push-Up on Knees
- Back Extension
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Plank with Leg Lifts

prospects.name: Full Body 11
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

We’re going to continue to build strength endurance by adding longer sets than previous routines and increasing the number of single move variations you complete back-to-back. Not only will you be asked to do multiple versions of a foundational move, but we also include Compound Sets. That means you'll be doing those combinations in challenging sequences. This combination maintains the same muscular demand as completing multiple sets of the exact same exercise but places greater demands on your nervous system to maintain balance and stability.

​

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 04
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

The fourth sequence in this Dynamic Focus series challenges your neuromuscular coordination with longer intervals. Integrated exercises with balance, unilateral drills, lower body strength, and jumping are all present. With a focus on stability toward the second half of the session, you’ll be forced to control your motion when tired. Your concentration and endurance will be pushed to maintain quality execution the entire time.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

prospects.name: Core Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve ALL of the muscles that make up your core? You’ve come to the right place. The Core Focus series builds up everything from your hip to your shoulders - front, back, and side._

​

To do this, we’ll take you through a variety of contraction types: eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding a position). The result? Improved core strength, stability, and endurance. You'll find exercises that carry over into other areas of your body, but all of the moves have a significant impact on your core. Level 1 is ideal for very beginners. Even then, you may find some of these moves challenging if you have never attempted them. That’s ok, take your time and pause the video if you need. Soon you’ll be on your way to mastering your core potential. In addition to a mat, you'll need some open wall space for this routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Side Bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Downward Dog
- Quadruped T-Spine Rotation
- Back Extension w/ opp arm & leg raise
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Quadruped w/ alternating arm raise
- Quad w/ leg raises
- Low Side Plank w/ toe-tap front/back
- High Side Plank w/ Hold
- Quad Toes w/ Alternate Arm Raise

prospects.name: Posterior Chain Focus 02
prospects.description:
_The primary objective of the Posterior Chain Series is to activate and strengthen the muscles on the back side of your body. This includes everything from your powerful glutes, hamstrings, and calves to the postural muscles of your upper back and neck._

​

The second session in this series focuses on activating and strengthening key structural stability muscles and developing optimal tension throughout the body. To do this, we use a combination of isolated and integrated movements in a variety of body positions and build on the movements from Posterior Chain 1. We also introduce tempo movements that require extra focus on timing and eccentric loading. Even though this is only Level 2, you may find some of these moves difficult to perform. That's ok, take your time and focus on performing the moves correctly even if you have to pause the video.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Recoil Hamstring Stretch

- Quadruped Chin Tucks

​

This level will really test your neuromuscular coordination and muscular power. We’ll do that through a tough mix of controlled, static holds as well as explosive, dynamic jumps. You may find yourself cardiovascularly challenged, which is great! Push yourself with quality movements and then recover with the mobility activities.

prospects.name: Full Body 01
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This is the first routine in the Full Body series. It introduces the most basic versions of moves that make up the majority of this program. Some of these moves may seem very basic but we encourage you to focus on perfect form and execution during these early levels so that when we turn up the heat you have things nailed. As you'll see, all the exercises at the lower levels will progress in a similar fashion going forward. We're building strength, but also fine-tuning your nervous system. As the program progresses you'll be asked to complete more difficult variations on each foundational move.

​

As with all the strength training routines, it helps if you’ve done a warm-up before getting started. That can be one of your favorite yoga routines, riding your bike on the trainer for 5-10 minutes, or doing a personal stretching routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Goblet Squat
- Single-Leg Squat
- Backward Lunge
- Hip Hinge with Reach
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Push-Up on Knees
- Back Extension
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Plank with Leg Lifts

prospects.name: Recovery Session B
prospects.description:
This session is designed to keep your body familiar with the basic movements of strength training without adding any extra fatigue to your system. This keeps your body adapted while allowing it to fully recover. To make the most out of your strength gains, you need to balance the hard work with adequate recovery. Given how short this session is, we strongly recommend completing a supplementary Yoga Session after this video. Something like Improving Posture, Shake Off the Day or Recovery Booster would be perfect.

​

**Exercises Included**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- High Plank to Pigeon Pose

prospects.name: Breathing More Deeply
prospects.description: Diaphragmatic Breathing is a calming exercise that encourages you to breathe deeply into your abdomen. This can help improve your ability to take in oxygen on the bike, as well as help you stay calm on focused when the pressure is on.

prospects.name: Full Body 12
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

Well done getting to this point! Clearly, you can handle a lot -- so things are going to get pretty heavy from here on out as we increase the difficulty of the moves, the duration of the interval, and the number of the sets. As you move through this session, really focus on keeping full control of your movements. You can only build strength in the muscles you can control. Also - because of the additional load, it's important that you’ve followed the progression and mastered the foundational exercises in the previous levels. One does not simply walk into Full Body 12. :)

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

Ready for the third workout in the Dynamic Focus series? All athletes, including competitors in endurance sports, benefit from training that better helps you react to external factors in varying directions; people, wind, waves, inclines, and surfaces. This sequence will prime you for these variables with varying tempos. With a combination of exercises that integrate three-dimensional motion this session will keep your neuromuscular system primed and ready for anything, no matter what type of rubber you’re on.

The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In Run Focus 4 you'll complete the foundational moves with longer, more challenging combinations to help improve your dynamic stability and muscular endurance. We also added strength exercises that incorporate a mobility component, particularly at the hips. Since you've already mastered the basics, focus on completing every repetition with perfect form, full range of motion, and controlled timing.

We’ll also focus on improving mobility, stability, and flexibility in the upper body. So get ready for great body-weight-based routines that focus on quality repetitions, endurance holds, and range of motion challenges._

​

Welcome to the second session in this series. We’re going to continue the focus on increasing strength in the chest, back, shoulders and arms. Many of the exercises will be familiar from Level 1, but you’ll likely find it a bit more challenging. That’s because we’ve made the durations a bit longer and the moves a little more complex. Challenge yourself to maintain quality repetitions throughout the sequence and strive for a full range of motion.

Full Body 13 is the first session in this series over 30 minutes long. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

Run Focus 3 adds an additional layer of difficulty to the foundational moves, with dynamic movements and sequences that help build balance and stability. There are also more integrated variations that incorporate the upper body for full-body activation. With 30 minutes of work and an exciting array of 26 exercises, this is a solid workout. While we still run you through the paces on lower body moves, this session will hit your upper body and core quite hard. This ensures that you continue to build full-body strength and stability. However, this routine has a greater concentration on upper back and posterior shoulder strength than the earlier sessions. The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In Run Focus 4 you'll complete the foundational moves with longer, more challenging combinations to help improve your dynamic stability and muscular endurance. We also added strength exercises that incorporate a mobility component, particularly at the hips. Since you've already mastered the basics, focus on completing every repetition with perfect form, full range of motion, and controlled timing.

This level will really test your neuromuscular coordination and muscular power. We’ll do that through a tough mix of controlled, static holds as well as explosive, dynamic jumps. You may find yourself cardiovascularly challenged, which is great! Push yourself with quality movements and then recover with the mobility activities.

prospects.name: Posterior Chain Focus 04
prospects.description:
_The primary objective of the Posterior Chain Series is to activate and strengthen the muscles on the back side of your body. This includes everything from your powerful glutes, hamstrings, and calves to the postural muscles of your upper back and neck._

​

In this routine, you’re going to keep building on the moves that you’ve mastered in the previous sessions (you have mastered them, right?). It’s time to increase the external load, though, so you’ll need a band to redirect tension and build more eccentric loading into the movements. The longer sets and difficult combinations will be challenging - embrace it! Also, even though the focus is Posterior Chain you will find integrated core moves throughout the session. Let’s rock!

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

_The primary goal of this series is to increase strength in the major muscles of the chest, back, shoulders and arms. We’ll also focus on improving mobility, stability, and flexibility in the upper body. So get ready for great body-weight-based routines that focus on quality repetitions, endurance holds, and range of motion challenges._

​

In this routine, we’re going to keep building on the foundational moves you’ve already learned, but we’ll also throw in some more complicated core exercises. The addition of three-dimensional core work will further build power from the chest and shoulders while improving posture in the back. Athletes in the water, on the road, or hitting the trail will benefit from this comprehensive sequence.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

prospects.name: Full Body 16
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

By this point, you’re no longer struggling with single-leg balance and stability, which allows us to really focus on building raw muscular endurance in your lower body. Additionally, this routine will place greater demands on your upper body and core than any previous session has. Not only do you have 10+ minutes dedicated to the muscles above your hips, but the progression of High Planks and High Side Planks means that even the “core-work” moves have a difficult upper-body component. We’re also going to ask a lot of your movement stabilization muscles -- it’s about time they were held to account.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

prospects.name: Full Body 01
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This is the first routine in the Full Body series. It introduces the most basic versions of moves that make up the majority of this program. Some of these moves may seem very basic but we encourage you to focus on perfect form and execution during these early levels so that when we turn up the heat you have things nailed. As you'll see, all the exercises at the lower levels will progress in a similar fashion going forward. We're building strength, but also fine-tuning your nervous system. As the program progresses you'll be asked to complete more difficult variations on each foundational move.

​

As with all the strength training routines, it helps if you’ve done a warm-up before getting started. That can be one of your favorite yoga routines, riding your bike on the trainer for 5-10 minutes, or doing a personal stretching routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Side to Side

- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Goblet Squat
- Single-Leg Squat
- Backward Lunge

- Push-Up on Knees
- Back Extension

- Plank with Leg Lifts

prospects.name: Recovery Session B
prospects.description:
This session is designed to keep your body familiar with the basic movements of strength training without adding any extra fatigue to your system. This keeps your body adapted while allowing it to fully recover. To make the most out of your strength gains, you need to balance the hard work with adequate recovery. Given how short this session is, we strongly recommend completing a supplementary Yoga Session after this video. Something like Improving Posture, Shake Off the Day or Recovery Booster would be perfect.

​

**Exercises Included**

Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

This final session in the series is designed to target all the components critical for success in running: strength, endurance, stability, mobility, and flexibility. This session targets common areas of weakness for runners caused by the repetitive motion that occurs in a single plane when running. You should now have the confidence to perform each repetition with quality for the entire interval duration. Focus, push through the temporary fatigue, and you'll come out of the session stronger, more stable, and more flexible.

Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

This final session in the series is designed to target all the components critical for success in running: strength, endurance, stability, mobility, and flexibility. This session targets common areas of weakness for runners caused by the repetitive motion that occurs in a single plane when running. You should now have the confidence to perform each repetition with quality for the entire interval duration. Focus, push through the temporary fatigue, and you'll come out of the session stronger, more stable, and more flexible.

​

**Included Exercises:**

- Squat Wide Stance Hands Forward
- Single-Leg Hip Hinge w/ Rotation
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Standing Hip Drive Hands Up
- Step Overs
- Alternating-Step Under
- Foot Circles
- Single-Leg Hip Bridge w/ Rotation
- Fire Hydrant
- Single-Leg squat to press
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Single-Leg Heel Raise
- Tempo Squat
- Tempo Split stance Hip Hinge
- Side Lunge w/ Knee Lift & Opposite Arm Press
- Inchworm
- Single-Leg Hop to Hold
- Downward Dog
- Frog Crunch
- High Side Plank Hold
- Bicycle Crunch
- High Plank w/ Opposite Arm & Leg Raise
- Pigeon Stretch
- Runner Stretch

prospects.name: Upper Body Focus 05
prospects.description:
_The primary goal of this series is to increase strength in the major muscles of the chest, back, shoulders and arms. We’ll also focus on improving mobility, stability, and flexibility in the upper body. So get ready for great body-weight-based routines that focus on quality repetitions, endurance holds, and range of motion challenges._

​

The final workout in the Upper Body series will not disappoint. Now is your time to show you can dominate the exercises for longer durations while maintaining quality repetitions. The primary components of strength training for the chest, back, shoulders, arms, and core are all present. There is plenty of mobility work for the complex upper body joints, too. Swimmers, cyclists, runners, and multisport athletes will all benefit from training at this level.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

++**Exercises Included:**++

- Overhead Shoulder Rolls w/ Stick

prospects.name: Full Body 17
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

By the time you arrive here, your form on the foundational exercises should be perfected to the point that even the most difficult variations don't phase you. So, to ensure you’re still challenged for continued improvements, you complete more sets of longer duration than ever before. Despite the increased time, we've kept the recovery period to 10 seconds, placing a solid demand on your cardiovascular system. No worries - thanks to your experience with the foundational moves, you'll be able to handle the extra fatigue while maintaining perfect form.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 06
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

It is time for Dynamic Focus 6! Maybe you’re a cyclist, runner, swimmer, or multisport athlete who wants the ability to surge harder and faster. Maybe you’re an outdoor enthusiast who wants to feel more confident in your element. In either case, this sequence is ideal for you. The exercise order will challenge you with a power push immediately followed by a unilateral task. No need to be discouraged if the first time through is difficult - sticking with it will produce results.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

prospects.name: Full Body 01
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This is the first routine in the Full Body series. It introduces the most basic versions of moves that make up the majority of this program. Some of these moves may seem very basic but we encourage you to focus on perfect form and execution during these early levels so that when we turn up the heat you have things nailed. As you'll see, all the exercises at the lower levels will progress in a similar fashion going forward. We're building strength, but also fine-tuning your nervous system. As the program progresses you'll be asked to complete more difficult variations on each foundational move.

​

As with all the strength training routines, it helps if you’ve done a warm-up before getting started. That can be one of your favorite yoga routines, riding your bike on the trainer for 5-10 minutes, or doing a personal stretching routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Goblet Squat
- Single-Leg Squat
- Backward Lunge
- Hip Hinge with Reach
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Push-Up on Knees
- Back Extension
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Plank with Leg Lifts

The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In Run Focus 4 you'll complete the foundational moves with longer, more challenging combinations to help improve your dynamic stability and muscular endurance. We also added strength exercises that incorporate a mobility component, particularly at the hips. Since you've already mastered the basics, focus on completing every repetition with perfect form, full range of motion, and controlled timing.

prospects.name: Posterior Chain Focus 05
prospects.description:
_The primary objective of the Posterior Chain Series is to activate and strengthen the muscles on the back side of your body. This includes everything from your powerful glutes, hamstrings, and calves to the postural muscles of your upper back and neck._

​

You’ve made it - the highest level in the Posterior Chain series. Here, we continue to load the back side of the body but also add in movements that require integration with other areas. Your muscular endurance will be challenged with external loads from bands, longer sets, and combination movements. To top it off, we even challenge your nervous system with tempo changes and unilateral exercises that require mental focus and muscular control.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

Dynamic Focus 7 is a big combination of cardiovascular endurance and neuromuscular coordination. Be prepared for longer power intervals. Slow down if you need to, but focus on the tempo holds and getting maximum drive off the ground in each repetition. After the recovery interval, take a deep breath and change your focus to mobility, stability, or flexibility.

prospects.name: Breathing More Deeply
prospects.description: Diaphragmatic Breathing is a calming exercise that encourages you to breathe deeply into your abdomen. This can help improve your ability to take in oxygen on the bike, as well as help you stay calm on focused when the pressure is on.

prospects.name: 03. Establishing the Goal Setting Habit
prospects.description:
**GOAL SETTING**

A clear plan of action is essential to any undertaking. Setting concrete, actionable goals will keep you motivated and on track; whether you’re eyeing the top podium step or the summit of the local climb. We will help assess where you are today, where you want to go, and identify the steps needed to get there.

​

In this module, you will enable consistent progress by creating a habit of identifying monthly and weekly goals, with weekly rewards for achieving those goals.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

​

​

​

​

​

prospects.name: 04. Getting Positive
prospects.description:
Thoughts matter. To accomplish big goals you need the ability to maintain a positive mindset, regardless of what life gives you. Here's an overview of the power of maintaining a positive mindset. We’ll introduce specific techniques that will help you identify negative thoughts, see obstacles as opportunities, and take a more positive path forward.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 05. Remembering Why
prospects.description:
Focus is essential to high performance. Without it, you can become distracted, give in to self-doubt, and struggle to motivate yourself. Strengthen your willpower through a deep understanding of your key motivators and then develop a system to remind you of them on a daily basis.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 06. Relaxing to Recover
prospects.description:
Here you will complete a full Progressive Muscle Relaxation session. It’s part guided meditation and part focus exercise. You should listen to this module at least once per week to get in tune with your body, release tension, and maximize recovery.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 07. Positive Self-Talk
prospects.description:
Improve your confidence and performance through three types of positive self-talk: Motivational, Instructional, and Reward. Here, we’ll look at the subtle and not-so-subtle effects that words have on our attitude and performance. You’ll listen more closely to the way you talk to yourself so you can improve that internal dialogue and become your own biggest fan.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[The Power of Positive Mental Strategies](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/episode-29-how-to-use-positive-self-talk-to-get-through-tough-moments-on-a-ride-mental-strategies)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Fitness.

prospects.name: 08. Improving Focus
prospects.description:
Develop an understanding of why focused concentration is so important to your performance. We will delve into what it means to be in “The Zone," look at the psychology and the physiology of peak performance, and what it takes to get there.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 10. First Month Review & Improve
prospects.description:
You’ll look back at each of your weekly goals, as well as your overall goal for the month, to see how you did. This is your chance to give yourself a pat on the back, celebrate your successes, and identify how you’re going to do even better.

​

After looking to see what the past month can teach you, you’re going to turn your attention towards what lies ahead, setting new monthly and weekly goals.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 11. The Successful Training Habit
prospects.description:
Let's zoom in on how you actually train, day in and day out. Great training sessions don’t just happen. You have to make a conscious effort, get everything together, then actually do the work. Successful athletes don’t leave their training to chance—they have a specific routine they go through **EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.** The more deliberate you are with your thoughts and actions before, during, and after your workouts, the better your training habit becomes and the greater your progress.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 12. Workout Review
prospects.description:
We’re going to take the techniques you've learned during the “Monthly Review and Improve“ module, and apply them to your training sessions. This module should be completed immediately after finishing a workout. Have your workbook with you so after the cool-down you can start the workout review exercise immediately.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 13. Kicking Ass in your Sleep Part I
prospects.description:
Pre-sleep visualization is a tool that helps build confidence and willpower. This module includes an exercise to detail what it will feel like to stand on the summit of your Big Mountain.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 14. Future You Is Now
prospects.description:
Here you'll revisit the description of yourself that you wrote when first embarking on this journey. It is an opportunity to see how far you’ve come, but also a chance to look ahead.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 15. Kicking Ass in your Sleep Part II
prospects.description:
This visualization exercise is designed to be completed when you’re in bed, ready to fall asleep. You’ll travel from your bedroom to the summit of your Big Mountain.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 16. Regular Monthly Review
prospects.description:
This process mirrors what you did in week five. If you feel like you’re making gains, it’s likely you’ve been getting the work in. If you’re not progressing—if you feel run down—look to see if there are any patterns.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 17. Overcoming Obstacles
prospects.description:
Rainbows? Puppy dogs? Not always. Sometimes things go wrong and this session will get you moving again. As a visualization exercise, this module is meant to be listened to whenever you feel stuck—whether that’s due to an obstacle you can’t see a way around, an injury, a loss of motivation, or any other reason which makes you doubt yourself. Even if you don’t have an obstacle right now, it’s a good idea to go through the module so you know what it’s about and when to use it. It will help you re-focus, reset, and reestablish your confidence in who you are and where you’re headed.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 07. Positive Self-Talk
prospects.description:
Improve your confidence and performance through three types of positive self-talk: Motivational, Instructional, and Reward. Here, we’ll look at the subtle and not-so-subtle effects that words have on our attitude and performance. You’ll listen more closely to the way you talk to yourself so you can improve that internal dialogue and become your own biggest fan.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[The Power of Positive Mental Strategies](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/episode-29-how-to-use-positive-self-talk-to-get-through-tough-moments-on-a-ride-mental-strategies)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Fitness.

prospects.name: 08. Improving Focus
prospects.description:
Develop an understanding of why focused concentration is so important to your performance. We will delve into what it means to be in “The Zone," look at the psychology and the physiology of peak performance, and what it takes to get there.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 06. Relaxing to Recover
prospects.description:
Here you will complete a full Progressive Muscle Relaxation session. It’s part guided meditation and part focus exercise. You should listen to this module at least once per week to get in tune with your body, release tension, and maximize recovery.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 18. Setting Event Goals
prospects.description:
Get clear on what an event really means to you and what your event-specific goals are.

​

"If you are going to win any battle, you have to do one thing: you have to make the mind run the body."

~ George S. Patton

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 19. Planning For Every Event Scenario
prospects.description:
Show up prepared by identifying things that could happen during the course of the event and how to deal with them.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 20. Preparing To Crush It
prospects.description:
This pre-event visualization exercise will help you get in the zone to deliver what athletes and sports psychologists call a “peak performance;” it’s when everything flows and operates at the highest level almost without any effort.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 21. How Did it Go?
prospects.description:
Once the dust has settled and your heart rate has returned to normal levels, listen to this module. It's meant to be completed 15 minutes after the event ends. Part two of this exercise is completed the next day when you’ve had time to process and reflect on everything that happened during the event day.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 02. Identifying Your Personal Big Mountain
prospects.description:
What - exactly - are you trying to accomplish? When you're ready to answer that question, this module will help you gain clarity on who you are as an athlete and identify your major goal—your Personal Big Mountain.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[The Importance of SMART Goal Setting](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/start-now-goal-setting-basics)' and '[How to use your personal outlook to set more effective goals](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/know-thyself-how-to-use-your-personal-outlook-to-set-more-effective-goals)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Sports Science.

prospects.name: 09. Focus Exercise
prospects.description:
Improve your ability to push away distractions and focus on the task at hand. This five-minute exercise will get you primed and ready to unleash your power from within. That means you should be in your kit and ready to train as soon as you complete this exercise.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.
